concise_definition: n. 疼痛, 酸痛; v. 痛, 感到疼痛

definitions.explanation_en: A continuous, dull, and often persistent pain, typically in a specific part of the body, less sharp than a stab but more enduring than a twinge.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指身体某一部位持续、钝重且常常持久的疼痛，不如刺痛剧烈，但比轻微抽痛更持久。
definitions.example_en: She had a dull ache in her lower back after standing all day.
definitions.example_cn: 她站了一整天后，腰部感到一阵钝痛。

definitions.explanation_en: To experience a persistent, often dull physical pain in a part of the body.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指身体某一部位持续感到钝痛。
definitions.example_en: His knees ache whenever it rains.
definitions.example_cn: 每当下雨，他的膝盖就会疼。

definitions.explanation_en: To feel a deep, emotional longing or yearning for something or someone, often accompanied by a sense of sadness or emptiness.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某人或某物产生深切的情感渴望，常伴随着悲伤或空虚感。
definitions.example_en: She ached to see her children again after being separated for years.
definitions.example_cn: 与孩子们分别多年后，她渴望再次见到他们。

comparison.analysis: “Pain” (疼痛) 是一个更广泛、更中性的术语，涵盖所有类型的不适感，包括锐痛、灼痛、刺痛等。而 “ache” 特指持续性、钝重的疼痛，情感色彩更强，常用于描述慢性或隐痛。
“Throb” (搏动性疼痛) 描述的是有节奏、跳动式的疼痛，常与脉搏同步，多见于头部或受伤部位。而 “ache” 是持续性的，没有明显的节律性，更偏向于沉重、弥漫的不适感。
“Long for” (渴望) 是一个纯粹表达心理愿望的动词，不包含身体感受。而 “ache” 作为情感动词时，带有强烈的生理隐喻，暗示渴望像身体疼痛一样真实、难以忍受，情感强度更高。
